SEARCH
Package net.elena.murat.math

Class FloatColor

java.lang.Object
net.elena.murat.math.FloatColor
public class FloatColor extends Object
Represents a color with floating-point red, green, blue components. Used for high-precision color calculations in ray tracing. Values are typically in [0.0, 1.0] range. Alpha channel is not supported - all operations are RGB-only.

      g - Green component (0.0 - 1.0)

      public FloatColor clamp01()
      Clamps all components (r, g, b) to the [0.0, 1.0] range.
      Returns:
      A new clamped FloatColor

    • isBlack

      public boolean isBlack(double threshold)
      Checks if this color is nearly black.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The maximum value for each component to be considered "black"
      Returns:
      true if all components are below the threshold

    • toAWTColor

      public Color toAWTColor()
      Converts this FloatColor to a java.awt.Color for rendering. Components are clamped and scaled to 0-255 range. Result is always fully opaque (alpha=255).
      Returns:
      A new Color object with RGB values

      Returns:

    • isSmaller

      public boolean isSmaller(FloatColor other)
      Checks if this color is smaller than another in all components.
      Parameters:
      other - The other color
      Returns:
      true if r less than other.r AND g less than other.g AND b less than other.b

    • inverse

      public FloatColor inverse()
      Returns the component-wise inverse (1/c). Prevents division by zero.
      Returns:
      A new FloatColor

    • subtract

      public FloatColor subtract(FloatColor absorption)
      Subtracts another color (absorption) component-wise. Clamps result to 0.0 minimum.
      Parameters:
      absorption - The color to subtract
      Returns:
      A new FloatColor
